author: James Reed

review: I have used the Fire TV stick for a couple of months now and have not been blown away by its performance.  We moved to a new house and are transitioning to wall mounting our TVs, and therefore trying to minimize the amount of wires and additional devices we connect to TVs.  I thought the Fire Stick would be a great all in one solution to replace Apple TV for programming and eliminate additional wires.  In general the Stick does that, but not without its flaws.Flaw 1 - as noted in the instructions, the Stick performs better when plugged in to a constant power source.  This of course requires running the power cord from behind the TV to an outlet, rather than relying on USB power from the TV.  When I looked into the impact of not using the power cord I read that it can take up to 45 seconds for the Stick to power on.  I personally think that is too long, so I use the power cord.Flaw 2 - the HBO Go and Watch ESPN perform terribly on the Stick.  Both apps are slow to load, have choppy navigation, and lose connection often.  HBO Go specifically takes multiple tries before the video actually loads and plays.  And each time it freezes, the Stick kicks back to the home page, forcing you to navigate through the slow and choppy app all over again!  HBO Go also does not have an option to access "Watchlist" which further adds to the difficulty of finding what you want to watch.Netflix and Prime Video options play with zero issue and hopefully Amazon can get the HBO and ESPN apps to perform the same.
